value.title: Page Navigation Buttons in Power BI
value.excerpt: Previously, to create page navigation in Power BI, you needed to create bookmarks, and buttons to action to that bookmark. However, recently, in the last version of Power BI Desktop, the ability to easily navigate to other pages using Buttons in announced. In this short video, I'll explain how you can

value.title: Power BI Calendar Visual
value.excerpt: Power BI doesn’t have a built-in calendar visual. Although there are some custom visuals for building a calendar, however, custom visuals come with some limitations sometimes. In this article and video, I explained how you can use built-in visuals to create a calendar visualization in your report. Get

value.title: Power BI Visualization Tip   Hide or Lock the Filter for Users
value.excerpt: I have previously explained that we have three scopes of filtering in the Power BI visualization. The filter created in the filter pane can be often changed or viewed by the user. However, there is a simple way to hide or lock it from the user. In this article and video, I explain how that works. Read

value.title: Previous Dynamic Period using DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Parallel Period is a function that helps you fetching the previous period of a Month, Quarter, or Year. value.title: Remove Digits or Keep them in Power BI Using Power Query
value.excerpt: There are a couple of useful actions that help a lot in cleaning data; removing digits, or keeping digits and removing everything else. In this short video, I’ll explain a simple method to do that using Power Query. Codes are in my blog article here: https://radacad.com/remove-digits-or-keep-them-in-power-bi-using-power-query

value.title: Split Column by Delimiter in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: If you have a delimiter character (or part of the text) that is repeated multiple times, and you want to extract all the text parts based on that, there is a simple way for it. In this article, I'll explain how to extract multiple parts of a text value based on a delimiter in Power BI using Power Query.

value.excerpt: When applying text transformations in Power BI using Power Query; two very important transformations that can help are; Trim and Clean. value.title: Computing a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can use DAX Studio to evaluate one or more measures in your data model. This is the first step to write, test, and debug your DAX measures in a productive manner.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Create Static Tables in DAX Using the DATATABLE Function
value.excerpt: The DATATABLE function can create static tables in a Power BI model specifying column names and data types. value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Star schema or single table in Power BI
value.excerpt: Is it better to build a model as a regular star schema or as a single table in Power BI? The answer is clear: a star schema is always the best choice. This video analyzes the performance differences of the two approaches. Article and download: https://sql.bi/704257?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Using USERELATIONSHIP in DAX

value.title: Create and share your first Power BI report
value.excerpt: With Power BI, you can create compelling visuals and reports. In this module, you learn how to use Power BI Desktop to connect to data, build visuals, and create a report that you can share with others in your organization. You then learn how to publish the report to the Power BI service, so that others can see your insights and benefit from your work.

value.title: Use DAX iterator functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you’ll learn about what the family of iterator functions can do and how to use them in your DAX calculations. Calculations will include custom summarizations, ranking, and concatenation.

value.title: DAX Table Functions: ALL, FILTER, & VALUES
value.excerpt: Learn how to incorporate DAX Table functions in Power BI with real world scenarios. Also learn how to quickly add these functions in to dynamic calculations in DAX.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/n-yO6WXE880" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to Get Round Corners on Visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: Follow these easy-to-follow instructions to learn how to round the corners of your visuals borders in Power BI.
